info.title: Eloverblik.Api.CustomerApi
info.description:
This API enables you to access your own data. There are two requirements to fulfill in order to get data: 1) You need to be authorized. 2) You need to create a relation to the metering points that you will access. Authorization is handled by using tokens. At first you will need a refresh token. You can generate a refresh token in the portal. Having a refresh token you can then access the /token endpoint and get a short lived access token. Using the access token all the below endpoints are accessible. Relations to metering points. In order to access data from a metering point you need to add a relation to the metering point. Check out the description of the different endpoints below on how to manage these relations. Correlation id. It is possible to set a correlation id in the request header. Using the 'X-User-Correlation-ID' (with an UUID). When provided this id will follow the request and finally end in the response header. This id can be used for tracking the request. Parallel to this id there is another internally id (Also a UUID), which is also returned in the response header as 'X-Correlation-ID'.

Please be aware that it is only possible to get time series data for the previous 5 years + current year.

Please note: Submission of meter readings to DataHub is no longer mandatory since end of 2021. Therefore, data may not be available for all metering points.

Limitations

At times, we may experience higher loads than our underlying data provider, DataHub, can handle. Therefore we have enforced some limitations on the usage of this API:

  • Calls to GetToken are restricted to 2 per minute per IP address.
  • The total number of calls per IP address is restricted to 120 per minute.
  • The total number of calls for all users is restricted to 1200 per minute.
  • You can request data for a maximum period of 730 days at a time

If you exceed any one of these limits, you will get an http error 429 - Too many requests.
If DataHub is not able to keep up with the demand - even if the above limits are not exceeded - you may get an http error 503 - DataHub unavailable.

Usage recommendations

  • Bundle requests for 10 metering points at a time.
  • Spread out multiple requests over a longer period.
  • Don't request data for periods of several years repeatedly.
  • If you get an error 429 or 503, wait 1min. before retrying.
  • If you get an error, then try to reduce the amount of metering points or reduce the date period of the request.
  • The Data Access token is active for 24h and should not need to be refreshed more than once a day.

Possible system error codes

General Error Codes

Code Name Description
10000 NoError No error - the operation succeeded.
10001 WrongNumberOfArguments The number of arguments is incorrect.
10007 NoCprConsent Missing consent for CPR lookup.

Metering Point

Code Name Description
20000 WrongMeteringPointIdOrWebAccessCode Invalid metering point ID or webaccess code.
20001 MeteringPointBlocked The metering point is blocked.
20002 MeteringPointRelationAlreadyExist Relation to the metering pointalready exists.
20003 MeteringPointIdNot18CharsLong Metering point ID must be 18characters long.
20005 MeteringPointAliasTooLong Alias for metering point is toolong.
20006 WebAccessCodeNot8CharsLong Web access code must be 8characters long.
20007 WebAccessCodeContainsIllegalChars Web access code contains invalidcharacters.
20008 MeteringPointNotFound The metering point was not found.
20009 MeteringPointIsChild The metering point is a childpoint.
20010 RelationNotFound Relationwas not found.
20011 UnknownError Unknownerror.
20012 Unauthorized Unauthorizedaccess.
20013 NoValidMeteringPointsInList No valid metering points in thelist.

MeterData

Code Name Description
30000 FromDateIsGreaterThanToday From-date is later than todays date.
30001 FromDateIsGreaterThanToDate From-date is later than to-date.
30002 ToDateCanNotBeEqualToFromDate To-date cannot be equal to from-date.
30003 ToDateIsGreaterThanToday To-date is later than todays date.
30004 InvalidDateFormat Invalid date format.
30008 RequestedAggregationUnavailable The requested aggregation is not available.
30011 InternalServerError Internal server error.
20009 MeteringPointIsChild The metering point is a child point.
20013 NoValidMeteringPointsInList No valid metering points in the list.
20010 RelationNotFound Relation was not found.
20011 UnknownError Unknown error.
20012 Unauthorized Unauthorized access.
20013 NoValidMeteringPointsInList No valid metering points in the list.

Token

Code Name Description
50000 WrongTokenType Invalid token type.
50001 TokenNotValid Token is not valid.
50002 ErrorCreatingToken Error occurred while creating token.
50003 TokenRegistrationFailed Token registration failed.
50004 TokenAlreadyActive Token is already active.
50005 TokenAlreadyDeactivated Token is already deactivated.

ThirdParty

Code Name Description
60000 ThirdPartyNotFound Third party was not found.

get.description:
Call this endpoint to verify whether we are currently operating normally.
            
If we are experiencing more traffic than we can handle, this endpoint may return HTTP 503.
The status currently refreshes every 60 seconds.

post.description:
This request is used for querying time series data for one or more linked or related metering points,
for a specified period and with a specified aggregation level.
            
Please note that it is only possible to retrieve time series data for the previous five years plus the current year.

400.description: If you do not have access to one or more of the listed metering point id(s)

post.summary: Returns a csv file containing a timeseries for each metering point in list.

get.description:
This request is used for retrieving a list of metering points associated with a specific user,
either a private or business customer.
            
If the parameter `includeAll` is `false` (default), only metering points actively linked or related to the user
(i.e., metering points with existing relations) are returned.
            
If `includeAll` is `true`, the list of actively linked metering points is merged with additional non-linked
metering points registered in DataHub to the CPR or CVR number of the user.
            
The CPR (for private customers) or CVR (for business customers) is retrieved using the supplied token.
            
For private customers, non-linked metering points are only returned if both the CPR and the user's name (as stated in the token)
match the data registered to metering points in DataHub.

parameters.name: includeAll
parameters.description: When includeAll is false, only the metering points with relations are returned. When includeAll is true the list will be a merge of the related metering points with a lookup using CPR or CVR. CPR is used if you are private user. CVR is used if you access as an employee.

401.description: When the provided token dont meet the requirements

post.description:
This request is used for linking one or more metering points to a user when the metering points are registered
to the user’s CPR or CVR in DataHub.
            
The system retrieves the CPR or CVR number associated with the supplied token and verifies whether the supplied
metering points are registered in DataHub to that CPR/CVR.
            
If the token is issued to a private customer, both the CPR and the user's name (as stated in the token) must match
the data registered to the supplied metering points in DataHub. If the match is successful, the relations are created;
otherwise, the request is rejected.
            
The logical flow is as follows:
First, use the /customerapi/api/meteringpoints/meteringpoints endpoint to retrieve a list of linked and non-linked metering points
(i.e., metering points with and without relations).
            
Then, use the Add Relation endpoint to link (i.e., create relations for) all or some of the non-linked metering points.

401.description: When the provided token dont meet the requirements

put.summary: Add relation with web access code
put.description:
This request is used for linking a metering point to a user by using the Web Access Code (WAC) for the metering point.
            
The WAC is provided by the electricity supplier and can typically be found on the electricity bill.
            
Adding relations using WAC is especially relevant for metering points associated with private users,
as many such metering points do not yet have CPR numbers registered in DataHub.

parameters.name: meteringPointId
parameters.description: The id of the metering point

parameters.name: webAccessCode
parameters.description: The web access code is provided by the distribution company

401.description: When the provided token dont meet the requirements

404.description: If the meteringpoint is not found or the web-access-code is invalid

post.description: This request is used for querying details (master data) for one or more (linked/related) metering points.

401.description: When the provided token dont meet the requirements

post.description:
This request is used for querying charge data—such as subscriptions, tariffs, and fees—for one or more
linked or related metering points.
            
Charges that are linked to the metering point at the time of the request or on any future date will be returned.
            
However, past and future changes to an existing charge are not included in the response.

400.description: If you do not have access to one or more of the listed metering point id(s)

delete.description: This request is used for deleting an existing relation to a metering point.

parameters.name: meteringPointId
parameters.description: The id of the metering point

400.description: If you do not have access to one or more of the listed metering point id(s)

post.summary: Returns a csv file with metering points details.
Returns a csv file containing current charges for a list of metering points.

get.description:
In order to get an access token you will need
a valid refresh token. This token can be fetched from the portal.
The token is a JWT token. There are tools that can read the content eg: https://jwt.io/
The token must be submittet in the request header like "Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOi..."

200.description: Else this even when errors are returned. Check the response.Success and the response.ErrorCode to know if the request performed as exspected

403.description: When a non-refresh token is used

401.description: When the provided token don't meet the requirements

BooleanApiResponse.description: Used as the 'root' class for all responses returned from the public API's. We need these to have a 'root' when the result is transformed to XML

addressCode.description:
Code specifying the type of contact address
            
Possible values:
            
D01 (Technical address), D04 (Juridical address).

streetName.description: Street name – part of the specific contact address.

buildingNumber.description: Building number – part of the specific contact address.

floorId.description: Floor id – part of the specific contact address.

roomId.description: Room id – part of the specific contact address.

postcode.description: Postcode – part of the specific contact address.

cityName.description: City name – part of the specific contact address.

countryName.description: Country name – part of the specific contact address.

contactType.description: Not used. Null is retuned. Will be removed in a later version of the API.

attention.description: Specifies if there a person or a c/o address to attention.

postBox.description: Specifies if there a postbox to attention.

protectedAddress.description: Specifies if the Address is protected.

codingScheme.description:
The coding scheme used for the sender mRID.
Fixed value = A10
This code specifies that the coding scheme used is the
Global Location Number (GLN 13) maintained by GS1

name.description:
GLN (Global Location Number) of DataHub.
Fixed value = 5790001330583

codingScheme.description:
The coding scheme used for the market evaluation
point mRID.
Fixed value = A10
This code specifies that the coding scheme used is the
Global Service Relation Number (GSRN 18) maintained
by GS1.

name.description: Unique metering point id consisting of 18 characters.

MeteringPointApiDtoListApiResponse.description: Used as the 'root' class for all responses returned from the public API's. We need these to have a 'root' when the result is transformed to XML

owner.description: Specifies a GLN (Global Location Number) representing the owner (grid operator).

price.description: Price of the subscription in dkkr.

meteringPointId.description: Unique metering point id consisting of 18 characters

parentMeteringPointId.description: The id of the related parent metering point. Only applicable for child metering points

typeOfMP.description:
Specifies the type of metering point.
            
Possible values:
            
D01 (VE Production), D02 (Analysis), D04 (Surplus production group 6), D05 (Net production),
D06 (Supply to grid), D07 (Consumption from grid), D08 (Wholesale services), D09 (Own production),
D10 (Net from grid), D11 (Net to grid), D12 (Total consumption), D14 (Electrical heating),
D15 (Net consumption), D17 (Other consumption), D18 (Other production), D99 (Internal use),
E17 (Consumption measurement point), E18 (Production measurement point).

energyTimeSeriesMeasureUnit.description:
Specifies the energy measurement unit relevant for the metering point.
            
Possible values:
            
AMP (Ampere), H87 (Count/Quantity), K3 (kVArh - KiloVolt-Ampere reactive hour),
KWH (kWh - Kilowatt-hour), KWT (kW - Kilowatt), MAW (MW - Megawatt),
MWH (MWh - Megawatt-hour), TNE (Tonne - metric ton), Z03 (MVAr - MegaVolt-Ampere reactive power),
Z14 (Danish Tariff Code).

estimatedAnnualVolume.description:
Estimated annual consumption/production of the metering
point. Only required for profiled settled metering points. May
exist for metering points with other settlement methods, but is
not necessarily maintained and should therefore not be used.

settlementMethod.description:
Settlement method of the metering point.
            
Possible values:
            
D01 (Flex settled), E01 (Profiled settled), E02 (Non-profiled settled).
            
If a metering point is flex settled or non-profiled settled or has
no settlement method, only non-profiled energy quantities are
registered for the metering point.
If a metering point is profiled settled, profiled energy quantities
(consumption statements) as well as non-profiled energy quantities can be registered for the metering point depending on
the meter reading occurrence (see further details in the section
regarding meterReadingOccurrence elsewhere in this table).
Profiled settled metering points no longer exist, since all profiled settled metering points were converted to flex settled metering points before 01-01-2021.
However, if a metering point used to be profiled settled, profiled energy quantities will still
be registered for the metering point in the period when the
metering point was profiled settled.

meterNumber.description: Meter number identifying the physical meter. Only available if the metering point has a physical meter.

meteringGridAreaIdentification.description: Id of the grid area to which the metering point belongs.

netSettlementGroup.description:
Net settlement group to which the metering point belongs.
            
Possible values:
            
0 (No Net Settlement), 1 (Net Settlement Group 1), 2 (Net Settlement Group 2),
3 (Net Settlement Group 3), 4 (Net Settlement Group 4), 5 (Net Settlement Group 5),
6 (Net Settlement Group 6), 7 (Net Settlement Group 7), 99 (Net Settlement Group 99).

physicalStatusOfMP.description:
Physical status of the metering point.
            
Possible values:
            
D03 (New), E22 (Connected), E23 (Disconnected).

consumerCategory.description: Applies to all consumption metering points. Specifies the threedigit consumer category for the electricityconsumption category which applies to the metering point.

powerLimitKW.description: Specifies the actual maximum limit for power (in kW).

powerLimitKWDecimal.description: Specifies the actual maximum limit for power (in kW) in decimal.

powerLimitA.description: Specifies the actual maximum limit for current (in ampere)

subTypeOfMP.description:
Specifies the sub type of the metering point.
            
Possibles values:
            
D01 (Physical - metering point has a physical meter),
D02 (Virtual - energy volume calculated by grid operator),
D03 (Calculated - energy volume calculated in DataHub).

productionObligation.description: Specifies for a production metering point that a production obligation applies to the metering point and that no change of supplier or move-in/move-out can be carried out for the metering point.

mpCapacity.description: Specifies the power in kW for the production facility.

mpConnectionType.description:
Specifies the connection type of a metering point for which net settlement is used.
            
Possible values:
            
D01 (Direct connected), D02 (Installation connected).

disconnectionType.description:
Specifies how the metering point can be disconnected by the grid operator.
            
Possible values:
            
D00 (For future usage), D01 (Remote disconnection), D02 (Manual disconnection).

product.description:
Product Id.
            
Possible values:
            
Item5790001330590 (Tariff), Item5790001330606 (Fuel quantity), Item8716867000016 (Active power),
Item8716867000023 (Reactive power), Item8716867000030 (Active energy), Item8716867000047 (Reactive energy).

consumerCVR.description: CVR number of the registered consumer. Only available for metering points registered to business consumers.

dataAccessCVR.description: Additional CVR number of the registered consumer. Only available for metering points registered to business consumers.

consumerStartDate.description: Date when the current consumer was registered to the metering point. Not available for child metering points. The date is expressed in UTC as specified in ISO 8601.

meterReadingOccurrence.description:
Specifies the meter reading resolution.
            
Possibles values:
            
ANDET (Other), P1M (Monthly), PT15M (15 Minutes), PT1H (Hourly).
            
If a metering point has meter reading occurrence = Other, only
profiled energy quantities (consumption statements) can be
registered for the metering point.
If a metering point has meter reading occurrence = P1M or
PT15M, only non-profiled energy quantities can be registered
for the metering point.
If a metering point has meter reading occurrence = PT1H, profiled energy quantities (consumption statements) as well as
non-profiled energy quantities can be registered for the metering point depending on the settlement method (see further details elsewhere in this table).
See further details regarding profiled energy quantities versus
non-profiled energy quantities in the sec

mpReadingCharacteristics.description:
Specifies how the metering point is read. Only applicable for profiled metering points.
            
Possible values:
            
D01 (Automatic meter reading), D02 (Manual meter reading).

meterCounterDigits.description: Number of digits on the counting mechanism of a meter. Only applicable for metering points with a physical meter.

meterCounterMultiplyFactor.description: The conversion factor on the counting mechanism of the meter. Only applicable for metering points with a physical meter.

meterCounterUnit.description:
Unit in which the counting mechanism of a meter meters the
energy consumption. Only applicable for metering points with a
physical meter.

meterCounterType.description:
Specifies whether the counter of a meter accumulates or balances consumption. Only applicable for metering points with a physical meter.
            
Possible values:
            
D01 (Accumulated), D02 (Balanced).

taxReduction.description: Specifies whether the consumer is entitled to a potential electricity tax reduction due to electric heating.

taxSettlementDate.description:
The date specifies either the commencement or termination of
an electricity tax reduction. The date is expressed in UTC as
specified in ISO 8601.

mpRelationType.description: Not used. No value is retuned. Will be removed in a later version of the API.

gridOperatorID_SchemeAgencyIdentifier.description:
Specifies which Agency the Balance supplier Identifier is associated with.
            
Possible values:
            
GLN: Global Location Number (https://www.gs1.org/standards/id-keys/gln)
            
EIC: The Energy Identification Coding (https://www.entsoe.eu/data/energy-identification-codes-eic/)

assetType.description:
Energy type.
            
Possible values:
            
D01 (Steam backpressure turbine), D02 (Gas turbine), D03 (Combined cycle),
D04 (Internal combustion engine Gas), D05 (Steam turbine condensation/steam), D06 (Boiler),
D07 (Stirling engine), D08 (Permanently connected electrical energy storage facilities),
D09 (Temporarily connected electrical energy storage facilities), D10 (Fuel cells),
D11 (Photovoltaics), D12 (Wind turbines), D13 (Hydropower), D14 (Wave power),
D15 (Mixed production), D16 (Production with electrical energy storage facilities),
D17 (Power-to-X), D18 (Regenerative demand facility), D19 (Internal combustion engine diesel engine),
D20 (Biocombustion engine), D99 (Unknown technology).

mpAddressWashInstructions.description:
Specifies if the address can be washed against the public Danish address register.
            
Possible values:
            
D01 (Washable), D02 (Not washable).

darReference.description: Specifies the reference id to the public Danish Address Register.

streetCode.description: Street code – part of metering point location address.

streetName.description: Street name – part of metering point location address

buildingNumber.description: Building number – part of metering point location address

floorId.description: Floor id – part of metering point location address

roomId.description: Room id – part of metering point location address

postcode.description: Postcode – part of metering point location address.

cityName.description: City name – part of metering point location address.

citySubDivisionName.description: City sub division name – part of metering point location address

municipalityCode.description: Municipality code – part of metering point location address.

locationDescription.description:
Comment related to the location or nature of the metering
point. Will most often be a description regarding the location of
the physical meter.

balanceSupplierName.description: Name of the current balance supplier.

balanceSupplierStartDate.description: Start date of the current balance supplier. The date is expressed in UTC as specified in ISO 8601.

balanceSupplierId_SchemeAgencyIdentifier.description:
Specifies which Agency the Balance supplier Identifier is associated with. (This is not available in Third party API)
            
Possibles values:
            
GLN: Global Location Number (https://www.gs1.org/standards/id-keys/gln)
            
EIC: The Energy Identification Coding (https://www.entsoe.eu/data/energy-identification-codes-eic/)

protectedName.description: Specifies if the name is protected.

success.description: True if the request succeded, False if not

errorText.description: Human readable description of the error

id.description: Used to map requests to responses. Ex: data is requested for 10 metering points. The 'Id' will be the requested metering point id for which the reponse belong.

MeteringPointDetailsCustomerDtoResponseL.description: Used as the 'root' class for all responses returned from the public API's. We need these to have a 'root' when the result is transformed to XML

subscriptions.description: A list of subscriptions for the metering point.

tariffs.description: A list of tariffs for the metering point.

fees.description: A list of fees for the metering point.

success.description: True if the request succeded, False if not

errorText.description: Human readable description of the error

id.description: Used to map requests to responses. Ex: data is requested for 10 metering points. The 'Id' will be the requested metering point id for which the reponse belong.

MeteringPointFeesDtoResponseListApiRespo.description: Used as the 'root' class for all responses returned from the public API's. We need these to have a 'root' when the result is transformed to XML

owner.description: Specifies a GLN (Global Location Number) representing the owner (grid operator).

prices.description: Price of the tariff in dkkr. and hour of tariff

price.description: Price of the tariff in dkkr.

mRID.description:
Identification of the market document. If several MarketDocument structures are contained in the same
message, then all of them will have the same id.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time of the creation of the document/message. The date/time is expressed in UTC as specified in ISO 8601.

success.description: True if the request succeded, False if not

errorText.description: Human readable description of the error

id.description: Used to map requests to responses. Ex: data is requested for 10 metering points. The 'Id' will be the requested metering point id for which the reponse belong.

MyEnergyDataMarketDocumentResponseListAp.description: Used as the 'root' class for all responses returned from the public API's. We need these to have a 'root' when the result is transformed to XML

resolution.description:
Specifies the resolution that the specific period covers.
            
Possible values:
            
PT15M (Quarter of an hour), PT1H (Hour), P1D (Day), P1M (Month), P1Y (Year),
PXD (X days - where X is a variable for profiled energy quantities covering various period lengths).

start.description: Start date of period. The date is expressed in UTC as specified in ISO 8601.

end.description: End date of period. The date is expressed in UTC as specified in ISO 8601.

out_Quantity.quantity.description: The quantity value associated with a given point, with a maximum 3 decimals

out_Quantity.quality.description:
The quality of the quantity associated with a given point.
            
Possible values:
            
A01 (Adjusted - will no longer be used after February 2020, specifies energy quantities calculated by DataHub),
A02 (Not available - grid operator submitted missing indicator, no quantity returned),
A03 (Estimated - quantity submitted as estimate by grid operator),
A04 (As provided/Measured - quantity submitted as measured by grid operator),
A05 (Incomplete - aggregated quantity where at least one component has missing indicator).

StringApiResponse.description: Used as the 'root' class for all responses returned from the public API's. We need these to have a 'root' when the result is transformed to XML

success.description: True if the request succeded, False if not

errorText.description: Human readable description of the error

id.description: Used to map requests to responses. Ex: data is requested for 10 metering points. The 'Id' will be the requested metering point id for which the reponse belong.

StringResponseListApiResponse.description: Used as the 'root' class for all responses returned from the public API's. We need these to have a 'root' when the result is transformed to XML

mRID.description: Unique metering point id consisting of 18 characters.

businessType.description:
A code specifying the nature of the time series.
            
Possible values:
            
A01 (Production), A04 (Consumption), A64 (Consumption - profiled).

curveType.description:
The coded representation of the type of curve being
described. Will always be A01, specifying that the curve
is made of successive Intervals of time (blocks) of constant duration (size), where the size of the blocks is
equal to the resolution of the period.

measurement_Unit.name.description: The unit of measure that is applied to a quantity.

Bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. Example: "Authorization: Bearer {token}"
